data.title: Homeschooling Hero: Christina Aguilera
data.meta_description: Christina Aguilera is an award-winning songwriter and singer who was homeschooled!
data.text:
by Christina Yeager

​Christina Aguilera was able to make her dreams come true as an aspiring singer. Eventually turning out tunes like “What A Girl Wants,” “Genie In A Bottle” and “Beautiful” after a stint on a popular Disney show as a teen. She also served as a judge of the well-known reality singing show “The Voice.” Christina Aguilera is an award-winning songwriter and singer who was homeschooled!

Christina Aguilera was born to Fausto Xavier Aguilera and Shelly Loraine Fidler in Staten Island, New York on December 18, 1980. Her early life wasn’t an ordinary one and she faced many difficulties regarding her education. After her parents divorced, Shelly moved to Rochester, Pennsylvania with her two daughters. They started a new life.

During this period, Christina developed an interest in the music industry. She was a gifted child and inherited her mother’s capabilities - her mother was a pianist and violinist. She gained confidence from her mother’s side. It wasn’t long when she started taking part in local talent competitions during elementary school.

Homeschooling

Most of her friend’s parents and schoolmates were jealous of Christina’s extraordinary voice and fame. They often bullied her. This is when her mother decided to homeschool Christina and help her peruse her goals. Yes, a well-known singer, Christina Aguilera was bullied so much in 9th grade that she had to quit school and start homeschooling for the better good. All of this started after she appeared on several TV shows including “Star Search.”

Accomplishments

In 1993, Christina gained attention as a Mouseketeer on The All New Mickey Mouse Club. The show included other actors such as Ryan Gosling, Keri Russel, Justin Timberlake, and Britney Spears who would all later become famous themselves. Later, she moved to Japan with her mother where her first hit song “All I Wanna Do” was recorded.

Her debut Album named after her own name “Christina Aguilera” earned her Grammy Award for the best new artist. That was her first official step and now the sky is the limit to her fame. Since then, Christina has launched dozens of songs and albums. In 2015, she earned Grammy Award for her hit ballad with A Great Big World “Say Something.”

Discography

Studio albums by Christina Aguilera are listed below:

Christina Aguilera in 1999

My Kind of Christmas in 2000

Mi Reflejo in 2000

Stripped 2002

Back to Basics in 2006

Bionic in 2010

Lotus in 2012

Liberation in 2018

Filmography

Have you watched “The Emojis Movie” released in 2017? Well, that movie contained a voice-over from Christina. Some other movies which incorporated her marvelous voice include Zoe (2018) and Burlesque (2010).

Currently

Christina Aguilera is still working as a singer and songwriter, wife and mother. Aguilera says, she would continue her journey as a songwriter, singer, and artist for as long as possible.
